meanings.definition: A line of text that is smaller or secondary to the main line of text.
meanings.sent1: The subline at the bottom of the page contained additional information.
meanings.sent2: The article had a subline summarizing the main points.
meanings.sent3: The subline made a joke about being the 'little sibling' of the main text.
meanings.sent4: Her words formed a subline of support beneath his main argument.
meanings.sent5: The subline, though small, added depth to the overall message.

meanings.definition: To place or arrange in a subordinate position.
meanings.sent1: She decided to subline the image to the corner of the poster.
meanings.sent2: The manager asked her to subline the new data in the report.
meanings.sent3: He sublined the task to show its importance in the project.
meanings.sent4: The artist sublined the background to highlight the main subject.
meanings.sent5: Sublining the details helped clarify the main idea.

meanings.sent1: The speaker used gestures to subline his key points.
meanings.sent2: She sublined the title to draw attention to it.
meanings.sent3: He sublined the importance of teamwork in his speech.
meanings.sent4: The music sublined the emotional impact of the scene.
meanings.sent5: Sublining certain words can enhance the overall message.
